name: Comics That'll Hurt Trivia Quiz | Hobbies | 15 Questions

questions.text: Who was one of the earliest Western comic artists to use the more 'manga' or 'anime' feel in their books?
questions.explanation:
Art Adams.

	Art Adams run on 'X-Men' solidly showed a Japanese influence that would in turn influence guys like Maduriera to popularize the style.

questions.text: In the book 'Watchmen' there is the subtlest of clues given to Rorshach's identity in the beginning. What form did it come in?
questions.explanation:
Newspaper.

	DC Direct WAS going to make a series of toys featuring the Watchmen, but Alan Moore put the kibosh on that.

questions.text: In the 'G.I. Joe' comic series a rogue viper went overboard and killed several Joes including Doc and Quick Kick. What KIND of Viper was he?
questions.explanation:
Saw.

	In these rather censored issues the Saw Viper ultimately met his hands at the Joe's resident ninja bad guy Snake Eyes.

questions.text: Artist Mike Allred has become famous for reinventing 'X-Force', but what book is he commonly known for?
questions.explanation:
'Madman'.

	Mike Allred has done a short film in the past few years called 'Astroesque'.

questions.text: Whose tragic suicide did the team X-Factor deal with early on in their career?
questions.explanation:
Warren Worthington.

	For those of you who didn't know, Worthington committed suicide from grief over loss of his wings. Later he was brought back as Death.

questions.text: There is a WWF superstar whose gimmick is to be the SuperHero 'The Hurricane' Name the character for his inspiration.
questions.explanation:
Green Lantern.

	Shane Helms aka Hurricane even has a Green Lantern Tattoo on his shoulder.

questions.text: Alex Ross is famous for putting celebrities in his work. What famous Rock Group appeared at the Fantastic Four's wedding in 'Marvels'?
questions.explanation:
The Beatles.

	He's also included groups like Led Zeppelin, The Who and Bjork in his works.

questions.text: What is Comic Book Shop Guy's store name in 'The Simpsons'?
questions.explanation:
Android's Dungeon.

	Comic Book Shop guy is said to represent EVERYONE who runs a comic shop.

questions.text: Back in the 70's Neal Adams had a hugely successful run on 'Batman'. Who was his writer?
questions.explanation:
Denny O'Neil.

	Denny is also famous for the spectacular run of 'Green Lantern Green Arrow' series.

questions.text: The Titans were famous for being one of the top books of the eighties. Who turned out to be the most ruthless of traitors in the group?
questions.explanation:
Terra.

	This run by Wolfman, and Perez ruled. Go get the archives or back issues.

questions.text: In the series 'Agents of the Noh: Scarab' by David Mack, what comic also written by David Mack do the characters read?
questions.explanation:
'Daredevil'.

	In the Kabuki series the 'Agents of the Noh' are government assassins, but have also grown into media icons despite their gruesome 'jobs'.

questions.text: The 'Uncanny X-Men' game released in 1988 for Nintendo featured what prominent 'X-Men' artist's work on the cover?
questions.explanation:
Silvestri.

	Uh, this game wasn't really the best. Interestingly enough, the 'Silver Surfer' game bore a remarkable resemblance to this one.

Reed Richards.

	Dr.Doom actually conquers America in 2099.

questions.text: Writer Artist Jhonen Vasquez debuted his animated series 'Invader Zim' in 2001.Which of his creations is on the main character's shirt?
questions.explanation:
Happy Noodle Boy.

	If you like sadistic killing then 'Johnny the Homicidal Maniac' might be the right book for you.

questions.text: What major comic company finally kicked the Comics Code in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Marvel.

	Not only has Joe Quesada done away with the code, he's made his own rating system so parents KNOW what they're buying their kids.
